qas.question: What type of occupation were Neolithic people considered to be proficient at?
What purposes were the production of farm tools used for?

answers.text: tending, harvesting and processing of crops

qas.question: What types of tools did early farmers use for crops?
What types of tools did early farmers use for food production?
What tool allowed early farmers to convert forest into arable land?
What type of occupation were manufacturers considered to be proficient at?

plausible_answers.text: tending, harvesting and processing of crops

qas.question: What purposes were the production of statuettes used for?
What types of tools did early farmers use for shelter?
What tool allowed early manufacturers to convert forest into arable land?

context: Neolithic people were skilled <a0_0><b5_0>farmers<b5_0/><a0_0/>, manufacturing a range of tools necessary for the <a1_0><b6_0>tending, harvesting and processing of crops<b6_0/><a1_0/> (such as <a2_0>sickle blades and grinding stones<a2_0/>) and food production (e.g. <a3_0><b7_0>pottery, bone implements<b7_0/>)<a3_0/>. They were also skilled manufacturers of a range of other types of stone tools and ornaments, including projectile points, beads, and statuettes. But what allowed forest clearance on a large scale was the polished <a4_0><b8_0>stone axe<b8_0/><a4_0/> above all other tools. Together with the adze, fashioning wood for shelter, structures and canoes for example, this enabled them to exploit their newly won farmland.
